newsitem.title: MEXICO: Pemex raises size of commercial paper program.
newsitem.headline: Pemex raises size of commercial paper program.

text.p: State oil monopoly Pemex said Monday it had raised the size of its commercial paper program by $100 million to $500 million because of heavy demand.
Bank of America was the lead agent for the transaction.
The commercial paper program has been guaranteed by a letter of credit from Credit Suisse.
BA Securities, a subsidairy of BankAmerica Corp, Goldman Sachs and Lehman Brothers will place the commercial paper, which will be issued at the beginning of December.
The deal was syndicated by 20 international banks.

"Petroleos Mexicanos (Pemex) continues to be a leader in gaining access to international financial markets. This program is the biggest done by a Latin American issuer and reflects the confidence of the international banking community in the administration of Pemex and its perspectives for the future," said Lorenzo Gonzalez Bosco, a director for Bank of America.
